file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-12-01-05 - FLOAT VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLOAT VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the check of the vent float valves. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY VENT FLOAT VALVES - OPERATIONAL ALL 28-12-01-700-801-A ♦ CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-12-01 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-12-01-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. VENT FLOAT VALVES - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) Do this task during the internal inspection of the fuel tank. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-802-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-802-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 531 531AB LH underwing area 541 541EB LH underwing area 631 631AB RH underwing area 641 641EB RH underwing area D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Fuel tanks EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-12-01 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Defuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) Remove the access panels ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100) and ( AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-802-A/400) as applicable, shown below to get access to the vent float valves. (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB/541EB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB/641EB. J. Operationally Check (Manual Check) Vent Float Valves (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) Do a check on the vent float valves for general condition and manually touch them to make sure that the hinged float moves freely. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the access panels as shown below. Refer to AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 and AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 28-11-01-400-802-A/400 as applicable. (a) LH fuel tank: • 531AB/541EB. (b) RH fuel tank: • 631AB/641EB. (2) Refuel the aircraft ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300) as applicable.
